meanings.definition: Used as an intensifier to express annoyance or emphasis.
meanings.sent1: I was deucedly tired after the long journey.
meanings.sent2: She was deucedly upset when her phone died.
meanings.sent3: The deuced alarm clock woke me up too early.
meanings.sent4: The deuced rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The deucedly loud music made it hard to concentrate.

meanings.definition: Used as an adjective to describe something as devilish or mischievous.
meanings.sent1: The deuced cat knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent2: He had a deuced grin on his face after pulling the prank.
meanings.sent3: The deuced squirrel stole all the birdseed.
meanings.sent4: Her deuced charm always got her out of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The deuced puppy chewed up my favorite shoes.

meanings.definition: Used as an adverb to intensify an adjective or adverb.
meanings.sent2: She danced deuced gracefully at the recital.
meanings.sent3: He ran deucedly fast to catch the bus.
meanings.sent4: The flowers smelled deucedly sweet in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The movie was deucedly boring, I fell asleep.
